item.title: [DISTRELEC-4536] SE Testing // Duplicate user creation
item.description: If a new customer is registered, in SAP two users are created. See screensthots, please investigate. Thanks

comments.comment: Hi Evangelos, please check from SAP-Side. Thanks.
Bug fiexd

item.title: [DISTRELEC-3212] Facet Search improvement: Application of filters via AJAX
item.description:
Current behavior:

  • if the user selects a value from a facet, or changes a range slider, the filter is immediately applied via a page reload. This approach was chosen for the sake of reduced complexity.
  • First feedback from Austria has shown that this is not ideal. The page scrolls back to the top, and the delay may be cumbersome with slower connections.

Improvement:

  • The proposal is to load the result of an applied filter dynamically via AJAX
  • This would include the result list, the list of selected facets, and the remaining available filter options in other facets.

A more detailed concept would have to be done before the refactoring to assure no special cases are left out.
item.summary: Facet Search improvement: Application of filters via AJAX

comments.comment:
Note: the decision on this impacts the recommended approach in this improvement ticket: DISTRELEC-3168
They should be evaluated together.

I estimate 6 - 9 Days of Frontend Work, depending on the final concept and how many edge cases will be found.

Below is a raw concept of what needs to be done.

1 Frontend

  • onClick, send the following data:
  • existing and new params
  • list of all facet groups that are visible
  • onClick, add/update/remove clicked filter to activated filter box (maybe not, see other CR ticket)
  • onResult, update list of products
  • onResult, update each facet group and counts
  • onResult, update URL in the Browser
  • onEmptyResult, do not page load to the no result page but show an info

2 Backend

  • send productdata and facet group data via ajax as json
  • if only one Product, do not go to the Product but show it in the list

3 Considerations / Limitations

  • URL immer aktuell halten erst ab IE10 (https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/Guide/API/DOM/Manipulating_the_browser_history#Browser_compatibility)
    Evtl. via Polyfill nachrüstbar, + 2d, evtl. buggy
  • Assuming the facets on the product finder page are conceptually the same

Raphael,
can you please do a BE estimate for this change?

I expect that the call for search/filtering will stay the same like today. So if somebody clicks on a filter this filter gets added to the current search query url and will be send to the controller. So this will stay the same like today.
So just the response have to be changed to a Json response instead of delivering the whole page.
@Dominic: Is my assumption correct?
If yes, I expect 1-3 days depending on edge cases. But I expect that it will be closer to 1 than 3 days. And my estimation does just include developing!

Yes it will stay the same.

  • If you get a request via ajax you need to deliver the response as json.
  • If you get the request as page load (as it is today), the response must stay the same (html).

New Ajax Actions:

  • select facet filter (checkbox / radio box)
  • apply or change a range filter
  • remove facet filter
  • add a facet from dropdown (is already ajax)
  • load next 10 products (is already ajax)

TBD Actions:

  • sort the result list (TBD)
  • select a deeper category

Currently, the following assumptions were made in discussion with Nando and Florian:

  • Selecting a deeper Category is done by pageload
  • Removing the current category is done by pageload because in this case, the user is getting redirected to the category overview page
  • All areas, where the user can make an interaction, which leads to different products being displayed, are disabled with an overlay during the ajax call
  • Work for Ticket DISTRELEC-3210 is also done on this Ticket together
  • Work for Ticket DISTRELEC-3213 is also done on this Ticket together
  • Work for Ticket DISTRELEC-3584 will not be done right now, since it is difficult to implement since its not a fact finder functionality
  • Facet Items with no Products will not be displayed as it was until now. See Ticket DISTRELEC-3584 for more Info
  • 5 Facet Groups will always be open. Plus possibly later loaded lazy facets groupds with previously selected active

The implementation is done. Currently, this are the known issues:

  • When de user selects a price filter, selects a value, the Products are being loaded. When he does a page reload, the Price Facet is displayed closed again (Same on Current live site)
  • The Url and the Back/Forward Button History is getting updated only from IE10 and higher. In other modern browser it is working as expected.
  • Share Email in IE8/IE9: The generated Link within the email only have the base url
  • Share Twitter in IE8/IE9: Only gets base URL as discussed with Nando
Can be tested after next deployment

item.title: [DISTRELEC-3210] Facet Search Improvement: Selected value from a facet should not disappear from list of values
item.description:
The current behavior is:

  • if the user selects a value from a facet, it is
    • added to the list of selected facet in the top area of the facet bar
    • removed from the list of values

First feedback from Austria (and personal experience) has shown that this is confusing: The point of reference is lost, and ifthe user wanted to select multiple values, it takes a long time to finde the neighbours.

Improved behavior:

  • If a value is selected, it is
    • added to the list of selected facets, AND
    • remains in the list of values with the checkbox checked

This would also be in accordance with best practice of comparable search functionalities.
item.summary: Facet Search Improvement: Selected value from a facet should not disappear from list of values

comments.comment: Agree
@Cornel: Can you change this behaviour as described?

Hello Raphael, i have analysed the required behaviour mentioned above. It won't be possible to find neighbours quickly because FACT-Finder returns the unselected and the selected facet values in different lists. So the position of a selected value within the unselected list gets lost.

However, to implement this CR the Backend and the Frontend need to be adjusted.

Do we realy want to deploy this feature with 1.1? I propose we specify the behaviour in detail and then bring in this feature with a later release.
@Nando/Florian: See the comment from Cornel. How should we go on with that?
I would say we go live with the current version and speak about it again for 2.0

Mostly backend work, independent if current page load implementation or Ajax implementation.

Frontend Work 0.5 days.

Raphael,
can you please do a BE estimate for this change?
Could you please estimate the effort? thx
Frontend Work for this task is getting done together with Ticket DISTRELEC-3212 and will be done, when that ticket is done.

This issue was discussed with Jan and Raphael Husi, summarizing the result:

  • By default, for each facet FactFinder returns a list of selected values, and a list of non-selected values (separately).
  • It is not possible to have FactFinder return a single list with both the selected and the non-selected values sorted the same way as if there were only non-selected values
  • Therefore, the approach will be: If a value is selected, it will move to the top of the facet with the checkbox marked as selected.

Remo,
in the context of DISTRELEC-3212, please also implement this change.

Selected Values appear in the filter list (there's no filter list for manufacturers) and on top of their facet.

Implemented by DISTRELEC-3212

item.title: [DISTRELEC-2388] Recommendation Engine: FF - Webtrekk
item.description:
Please set up the recommendation engine import from Webtrekk into Fact Finder.

  • Mark Diggelmann should configure the file export to the Fact Finder FTP
  • Fact Finder should build the script to match the three Webtrekk files, prepare the reco engine import file and configure a regulary automatically import.

Please involve Rafael Burlet to communicate with Webtrekk and FF.

comments.comment:
The script is set up, that converts the Webtrekk files for FF.
Open: Mark Diggelmann has to upload the webtrekk data to FF. Raphael Burlet has the necessary information.
@Mark: Can you pleas upload the data to FF. If you need the credentials, please ask Raphael Burlet.

Hi Rafi

  • FF FTP Credentials: Needs to be provided.
    In which folder shall the files be stored? FYI: No dedicated file naming schema defined.
  • General structure of the files okay (in particular 3rd file - compare e-mail dated Mo 16.12.2013 10:58)?
  • Shall the files be provided on a daily basis? For which timeframe retrospective?

Pending feedback:

  • Brauchst du generell als Metrik 'Value Purchased Products' (d.h. Umsatz pro gekauften Produkt) oder den 'Amount' (gemäss Fact-Finder Vorgabe – vgl. dein Printscreen weiter unten)?

Thx Mark
Please advise. Thx

• Credentials sent by Mail.
  • FF-Q-Server: 10.191.23.12
  • Pfad: /env-hp-q/factfinder/ff-resources/FACT-Finder-hybris/recEngine/
  • Naming: Wie bisher.
  • On a daily basis, Retrospective 1 month.
  • Als Metrik wird der Amount genommen.

Noch offene Frage:

General structure of the files okay (in particular 3rd file - compare e-mail dated Mo 16.12.2013 10:58)?

Anschlussfrage: Für welche Länder sollen die Daten zur Verfügung gestellt werden?

FYI: Eine Bearbeitung ist meinerseits heute nicht mehr möglich (zu kurzfristig). Ich werde dies anfangs nächster Woche angehen können.

Bests, Mark

Zu den Fragen:

  • Yes.
  • Vorerst AT, CH, IT - Später mehr.

Ciao Rafi

Der FTP-Zugang funktioniert noch nicht leider noch nicht wie gewünscht (trotz zusätzlicher Proxy-Settings). Ich kann mich ohne Proxy-Settings zwar auf das Remote-Verzeichnis verbinden, bis dato aber noch keine Daten schreiben. Wie soll ich dafür vorgehen?

Die Webtrekk-Daten (3 Webtrekk-Feeds je für CH, AT und IT) sind für heute auf dem folgenden Public-Verzeichnis abgelegt: \\dae.datwyler.biz\dae\Distrelec\Marketing Services\ALL\02 E-Business\05 Business Intelligence\Stakeholder\Fact-Finder\14-01-13

Die Daten werden ab Morgen direkt von Webtrekk auf den FF-FTP gespielt. Es sollte dabei entsprechend nicht zum einem Proxy-Issue kommen.

Bests, Mark

…noch eine kleine Info: Die Webtrekk-Daten werden als .zip-Files (nicht anders möglich) auf dem FF-FTP abgelegt. Müsste wohl durch das Transformationsskript noch berücksichtigt werden.

Bests, Mark

Ciao Rafi

Ist mir gerade aufgefallen. Für die automatisierten täglichen FF-Reco WT-Export bin ich auf ein FTP-Host angewiesen, der ausserhalb des internen Netzwerks ansprechbar ist.

Ich sehe folgende beiden Alternativen:

  • Angabe eines FTP-Hosts, der ausserhalb des internen Netzwerks ansprechbar ist.
  • Ich lege die Daten auf dem bestehenden WT FTP-Account von Önder (ftp.distrelec.com) ab und Ihr holt euch die Daten dort ab.

Please advise!

Bests, Mark

Wie sieht es diesbezüglich aus?

Thx Mark
Bitte um einen kurzen Status dazu. Thx Mark

@Mark: Bitte auf dem bestehenden FTP ablegen.
@Raphi: Kannst du das script so anpassen, dass die Files vom bestehenden FTP-Verzeichniss geholt werden und vor dem verarbeiten noch entpackt werden?

Done --> Files werden täglich auf dem WT FTP-Account von Önder (ftp.distrelec.com) abgelegt (Verzeichnis: '/factfinder').

Bests, Mark

Currently the FF servers are not able to do outgoing FTP connections. I forwarded it to Daniel Gisler to open the corresponding ports.
Until this change is done, we are blocked.
Are there further actions needed on this or can it be closed?
We are still waiting on HP/Atos that the connection between FF and the FTP works.

Hi Raphi

I do now receive the '8-digit ID of purchased products'-values in Webtrekk. To note: The pre-set FF Reco Export to ftp.distrlec.com is structured as illustrated on the attached screenshot. There are some Webtrekk-limitations regarding Pivot Tables and Custom Parameters. Meaning I cannot replace the dimension 'Purchased Products' by '8-digit ID of purchased products'.

Two options:

I) Single reports: Order ID / Order Time / 8-digit ID of purchased products (-> dropping the 'Purchased ca5_manufacturer' dimension)

II) Two reports: a) Order ID / Order Time / 8-digit ID of purchased products b) Order ID / Order Time / Purchased ca5_manufacturer (-> you would then join the two reports via scrip)

-> Which option would you prefer?

Bests, Mark
Decision taken -> Option I

I have adapted the daily CH Webtrekk-export accordingly. Ex tomorrow the report should contain the following dimensions (Order ID / Order Time / 8-digit ID of purchased products). Could you please verify that and inform me on whether I shall roll-out this report to any further countries?

Thx Mark

Script has been implemented. The Script is downloading the Webtrekk data from the FTP and converts the data in the correct format for FF.
The script gets executed by a cron job at 12:00 each day.
FF is importing the data at 13:00 so that we can be sure that the data has been fully converted.
At the moment the automated import is just active for CH_DE, CH_FR and CH_EN as the new reporting from Webtrekk is just active for CH.
Mark is currently setting up the new report as well for IT, AT and LT. The data is ready by tomorrow morning.
So I'm going to active the cron jobs also for this countries after today lunch time.
Cronjobs have been activate for all available countries (CH,AT,IT,LT)

item.title: [DISTRELEC-2052] Product List: Linked elements
item.description:
Currently, the full area of a product list line item is linked to the product detail page. This has been implemented with HTML, which has the side effect that texts within a line item cannot be marked and copied.

An implementation with JavaScript could allow for both: texts that can be copied, and the full area of the line item being linked to the product detail page. The effort for this would be about 0.5 PD.
Goal: same behavior as here http://www.conrad.de/ce/de/Search.html?search=widerstand

An alternative approach with no significant effort would be to only link the product image and the product name, or leave it as it is.

This should apply to all product lists in the shop

  • category navigation product list
  • search result list
  • favorite list
  • product list
  • import tool result list

The list in the cart should be fine, as there only the product name and image are linked. Same applies to order review page product list, and to the lists within my account (e.g. order history detail)
This case is not relevant for the compare list

comments.comment: Decision Florian: Implement Java Script solution

As per Dominic:
link attribute auf titel und bild damit es bei no-JS noch funktioniert. zusätzlich per JS click event hinzufügen analog conrad und target abfragen

Example Conrad: http://www.conrad.de/ce/de/Search.html?search=widerstand
Dean, what is the status of this? Why is this still with you?
No confirmation from Oana.
Dean, I saw that you reopened this. Do we need this for AT? Then please assign for immediate implementation.

Hi Beat,

can you please take care of this change request. Thank you in advance. Dean.

I have to double check: do we really want a javascript redirect on click for the attributes table? acting like a link would again not allow a user to highlight (=click) text on attributes unless he is fast enough.

Dominic,
can you answer this question?
Will be resolved along with DISTRELEC-4581

This Part is already done. I did a combined solution, where there is a standard anchor around the image and the title, also needed for SEO Reasons. The Webtrekk is still done the same way. Now instead of also having an anchor around the attributes, the click is captured by JS and if it was not a text selection, the user is getting routed to the detail page.
